scenes.title: The Rust-Bound Gate
scenes.text: I stood before the cemetery. Its iron gate was a skeleton's grin, half-open and inviting. A heavy, swirling smoke, like cold breath, coiled around the bars. I held a single, unlit candle in my hand. A whisper, like dry leaves skittering on stone, seemed to ask why I had come. I didn't have an answer, only a deep, pulling ache in my chest.

scenes.title: The Stone Saint
scenes.text: The gate groaned open. Inside, the smoke was thicker, smelling of damp earth and regret. It swirled around the ankles of a marble statue aheadâ€”a saint, its face worn smooth by a century of rain. Its stone eyes seemed to follow me. From behind the statue, a spectral figure drifted into view, a man in old-fashioned clothes, his form indistinct, his face a mask of sorrow.

scenes.title: The Pauper's Path
scenes.text: I found a place where the stone wall had crumbled. I slipped through the gap into a newer section of the cemetery. The graves here were simple, marked by plain stones. The smoke was thinner, but it clung to the ground in strange, shifting patterns. Spectral figures, little more than smudges of light, drifted between the graves, moving without purpose. They seemed lost.

In the center, a more distinct spectral figure of a woman gestures vaguely towards a large crypt in the far background. My hand holding a lit candle is at the bottom of the frame. scenes.title: The Forgotten Child
scenes.text: I moved closer to the spirit. It didn't look at me, but pointed a translucent finger toward a small, neglected grave. A tiny lamb was carved into the stone. The name was gone, worn away. At the base of the headstone sat a small, silver locket, miraculously untarnished. The spirit's whisper was clear now. 'Not mine... but she is waiting.' I picked up the locket. It was cold, and felt heavy with sadness.

choices.text: Take the locket and search for its owner.

scenes.title: The Family Plot
scenes.text: I found myself before a grand, gated family plot. A single name was carved above the entrance: 'Blackwood.' My name. The ache in my chest intensified. Inside, a tall, imposing spectral figure stood guard over a freshly disturbed grave. It was not sorrowful like the others. It was angry. Its form was dark, less a ghost and more a solid piece of night. It turned its empty gaze on me, and on the locket in my hand.

scenes.title: The Debt Repaid
scenes.text: I stepped forward, my heart pounding. The dark figure did not move. I knelt and gently placed the silver locket on the earth of the grave. For a moment, nothing happened. Then, a soft light bloomed from the locket, pushing back the smoke. The dark figure dissolved, and all around me, the spectral forms paused. They looked up, as if seeing the sky for the first time, and then faded into peaceful nonexistence. I finally understood. The debt was not of money, but of memory.

scenes.title: The Gardener's Toll
scenes.text: I held the locket up like a shield. 'Leave them be,' I said, my voice shaking. The dark figure drifted toward me. It did not speak. It reached out a hand made of shadow and smoke. When it touched my forehead, my memories unspooled. My name, my life, my reason for being there... all of it drained away into the cold earth. I felt my body grow light, my form indistinct. I was just another sorrowful shape, doomed to wander the marble garden.

scenes.title: Lost Among the Stones
scenes.text: Fear won. I dropped the locket and turned, stumbling away into the cemetery. But the path was gone. Every direction I turned, the same weeping angel or crumbling obelisk appeared. The whispers grew louder, coming from all sides, weaving a confusing tapestry of forgotten names and lost moments. The world became a shifting maze of stone and smoke. I ran until I could no longer remember why I was running.
